item.description:
When:
8:30 for a 8:45 AM start
Where:
Lafayette Place/ Franconia Ridge trailhead
North Bound Lane of I-93
108.2 mile marker
Lincoln, NH

The hike:
Join our group in this classic 3 mountain loop hike that bags two wonderful 4000 footers. We'll ascend via the Falling Waters Trail which parallels the Dry Brook with several tall blue & green ice formations around the waterfalls for more than a mile. We'll exit the treeline just below the summit of Little Haystack Mtn (4780' not on the list), rest, snack, soak up the sun and the incredible views. We'll move on to summit Mt Lincoln (5089' on the list!) rest, snack and on to Mt Lafayette (5260' on the list!) Between the three summits is the classic ridge walk, above tree line for almost 3 miles with spectacular views continuously in every direction. This loop hike is 8.9 miles, 3,900' of elevation gain, and completed in about 7 hours. You may become addicted to hiking after this fantastic adventure! http://photos1.meetup...

weather outlook is great!

disclaimer

PLEASE MAKE SURE YOUR PROFILE IS COMPLETE SO THE ORGANZERS CAN REVIEW YOUR HIKING EXPEREINCE. NO PROFILE-NO HIKE!




Update on 06/02/2010:

I created hand-drawing Trail Routes for this hiking on 2D and 3D Topo maps and added them as link.
Please review this before you join hiking. Ideally, hikers who joins this event, are supposed to print out the Topo map (either 2D or 3D) and bring it with you. (If you've already have map and compass, you don't have to print this out.)
item.name: Lincoln Lafayette Franconia Ridge Loop
